Class NeonHost

java.lang.Object
com.quietterminal.projectneon.host.NeonHost
All Implemented Interfaces:
Lifecycle, AutoCloseable
public class NeonHost extends Object implements AutoCloseable, Lifecycle
Neon protocol host implementation. The host manages game sessions and coordinates clients through a relay. Implements Lifecycle for clean start/stop semantics.

      public void stop()
      Description copied from interface: Lifecycle

    • run

      public void run() throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Runs the host processing loop. Call start() first to register with the relay.
      Throws:
      IOException - if a network error occurs
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted

    • startAndRun

      public void startAndRun() throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Starts the host, registers with relay, and runs the processing loop. Combines start() and run() for convenience.
      Throws:
      IOException - if a network error occurs
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted

    • startAsync

      public Thread startAsync()
      Starts the host in a background thread using virtual threads if available (Java 21+). Falls back to platform threads on older JVMs.
      Returns:
      the started thread

    • processPackets

      public int processPackets() throws IOException
      Processes incoming packets. Returns the number of packets processed.
      Throws:
      IOException
